summary: Diff focuses on frontend runtime error normalization and UI surfacing of technical details (stack/raw error, request/canister/method) via AsyncState and a StartupErrorBoundary. There is no evidence of changes to build/deploy tooling or of a new build/deploy attempt with captured deployment logs, so REQ-15’s deploy-success and deploy-log capture aspects are not implemented in the shown diff.

missing_requirements.requirement: Retry the application build and deployment, capture the full deployment error output, and fix the underlying issue so the canisters and frontend deploy successfully on the Internet Computer.
missing_requirements.reason: The diff shows only frontend TypeScript/React changes for runtime error handling and UI display. There are no changes to deployment configuration/scripts, no backend/canister build adjustments, and no evidence of capturing and surfacing full *deployment* command output/stack traces for diagnosis, nor evidence that `dfx deploy` now succeeds.

hallucinated_features.description: Frontend runtime error classification (stopped canister / authorization) and user-friendly messaging with parsed technical details (requestId/canisterId/method/rawError/stack).
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-15 is about build/deploy failure resolution and capturing *deployment* error output; these runtime UX/error-normalization enhancements are not explicitly requested and may be considered new functionality beyond deploy stability work.

hallucinated_features.description: UI for displaying and copying technical error details in AsyncState error cards (collapsible ‘Technical details’, copy-to-clipboard).
hallucinated_features.reason: Not explicitly required by REQ-15; it surfaces runtime error diagnostics to users rather than capturing deployment command output.

hallucinated_features.description: New/expanded StartupErrorBoundary UI with technical details and copy-to-clipboard for startup errors.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not explicitly requested by REQ-15; focuses on frontend runtime startup errors instead of build/deploy pipeline failures.
